intro: Cyclostemon eglandulosus, commonly known as the smooth cyclostemon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or on limestone soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely used for commercial purposes.
